title: save.request
description: Request to persist data deterministically to a destination (URI, key, file, bucket, or chain) with explicit limits, durability semantics, A2A-style channel metadata, optional auth, delegation, and context for multi-agent flows.

x402.description: x402 envelope describing the verb, version, and optional routing metadata.

actor.description: Logical caller (wallet, ENS name, application, or agent identifier).

limits.description: Guardrails for payload size, concurrency, and latency.

max_bytes.description: Maximum number of bytes to persist for this operation.

max_latency_ms.description: Optional upper bound on end-to-end latency in milliseconds.

max_attempts.description: Maximum number of write attempts or retries allowed.

target.description: Destination descriptor for where the data should be saved.

uri.description: URI to write to (e.g., s3://bucket/key, ipfs://CID, https://..., db://...).

bucket.description: Bucket or container name, if applicable.

key.description: Key or object identifier within the bucket, KV store, or document store.

network.description: Blockchain or network context for chain writes (e.g., mainnet, base, optimism).

resource_id.description: Optional resource identifier for document/record-oriented stores.

data.description: Payload to persist and format hints.

content.description: Raw content to persist (text, JSON string, or encoded data).

content_type.description: MIME type or logical content type (e.g., application/json, text/plain).

encoding.description: Encoding hint for the content (e.g., utf-8, base64).

checksum.description: Optional checksum of the content for integrity verification (e.g., sha256 hex).

semantics.description: Write semantics: idempotency, concurrency control, and durability.

if_match_etag.description: Optional ETag that must match the current ETag for the write to succeed.

if_none_match.description: If true, write MUST fail if a resource already exists at the target.

durability.description: Desired durability or replication semantics hint.

fsync.description: If true, the agent SHOULD ensure the write is flushed to durable storage before acknowledging.

channel.description: A2A-style channel configuration describing how this request is transported.

input_modalities.description: Modalities used for the request payload.

endpoint.description: Concrete endpoint URI for this invocation (e.g., HTTPS URL, JSON-RPC endpoint, queue/topic).

auth.description: Authentication metadata. Concrete credentials are implementation-specific and MUST NOT be logged in full.

scheme.description: Auth scheme (e.g., none, api_key, oauth2, signed_message).

api_key_id.description: Optional opaque identifier for the API key used.

actor_wallet.description: Optional EVM wallet address associated with this request.

signature.description: Optional detached signature (e.g., EIP-191) proving possession or intent.

delegation.description: Swarm-style delegation policy for multi-agent flows (e.g., handoff to storage gateways, pinning agents, or archival backends).

allowed.description: Whether the agent is allowed to hand off or delegate this request.

targets.description: Preferred downstream agents (e.g., ENS names or canonical identifiers).

reason.description: Human-readable reason or intent for allowing delegation.

context.description: Optional conversation or workflow context for multi-step or multi-agent interactions.

parent_task_id.description: Identifier of the parent task, if this request is part of a larger workflow.

thread.description: Minimal structured history; format is intentionally implementation-defined.

metadata.description: Non-normative metadata for routing, billing, or analytics. MUST NOT change the core semantics of the request.
